description.narrative: Cooperativa Nacional de Productores de Leche (Conaprole) is Uruguays leading dairy producer and one of the lowest cost producers in the world. Conaprole has eight production plants in which they produce a wide range of dairy products including liquid milk, milk powder, yogurt, cheese, butter, ice cream, and milk by-products, both for the local and export market. The Project consists on: i) expansion of milk powder capacity at its Villa Rodriguez plant to produce more value-added products; ii) revamp the plants waste water treatment plants; and iii) replace the existing boiler system with a more efficient one.

Farmers Reached: The Project will result in a 16% additional milk intake capacity for Conaprole, which would translate into large production volumes of raw milk for the cooperative members. The production of high value-added products such as infant formula will allow Conaprole to generate better returns for its membership base. Environmental outcomes: Conaprole has a few areas of improvement on the E&S front (ammonia safety, occupational safety and health, waste water treatment). IFC's continued engagement together with the Cooperative's strong commitment will contribute to the adoption of best industry practices.
